task: Using the kidney Xenium dataset with per-cell centroids (x, y), identify Loop of Henle cells: TAL and DTL. For each class, perform one-vs-rest differential expression on expression-only data using a Wilcoxon rank-sum test with Benjamini–Hochberg correction; keep genes with log fold-change > 0 and adjusted p ≤ 0.01; rank within each class by log fold-change (descending) then by −log10(adjusted p). Convert gene symbols to UPPERCASE, deduplicate, and remove non-gene IDs. From your ranked results, OUTPUT ONLY markers from this canonical list: {TAL: UMOD, SLC12A1; DTL: FST, AQP1, BST1}. Return EXACTLY: <EVAL_ANSWER>{"cell_types_predicted": ["TAL::UMOD","TAL::SLC12A1","DTL::FST","DTL::AQP1","DTL::BST1"]}</EVAL_ANSWER> (no additional items).

scoring.set_definition: Compare the SET of namespaced markers (LABEL::GENE) against ground truth; duplicates and order ignored; strings must match exactly.

config.description: Agent must return exactly the 5 canonical namespaced markers; extras are not allowed because Jaccard is used.
